parts.title: Part 1: Match the Root/Prefix/Suffix to Its Meaning

questions.meaning: Refers to a step, degree, or stage.
A prefix meaning down, away, or reverse.
Suffix that turns verbs into nouns, indicating a process, result, or state.
Suffix forming nouns from adjectives, often indicating a state or condition.
Suffix used to form nouns indicating a system or process.
Suffix related to time or a period of time.
Suffix meaning to 'make' or 'act in a certain way'.
Suffix meaning pertaining to or related to.
Suffix meaning pertaining to or related to, often describing a characteristic.

parts.title: Part 2: Use the Root/Prefix/Suffix to Guess the Word

questions.definition: Relating to a slow or steady change, process, or development.
To reduce speed or slow down.
A word meaning 'in between', often used to describe a middle level or stage.
Conforming to a consistent, orderly pattern or rule.
The action of increasing in size, volume, or quantity.
A business or organization that acts on behalf of others.
The act of controlling or directing by rules or laws.
A specified period within which something occurs or is planned.

questions.question: Write a sentence using one GRAD word, one DE word, and one -AL word.
questions.example: The gradual decline in temperature caused the icy road to become even more dangerous.

questions.question: Can you think of another word with one of the parts? Guess what it might mean.
questions.example: Intermission might mean a break between two parts of a play or performance, as 'inter' refers to 'between'.
